invalidExamples.name: Alt Text Too Long
invalidExamples.description: Image with alt text exceeding 255 characters

data.alt_text: This alt text is extremely long and exceeds the maximum allowed length of 255 characters. It keeps going and going with more descriptive text to demonstrate what happens when alt text is way too verbose and detailed for practical use in web accessibility. This continues with even more text to ensure we definitely exceed the 255 character limit that is enforced by the schema validation rules for alternative text fields.

expectedErrors: Alt text must be 255 characters or less
invalidExamples.notes: Should fail due to alt text length

invalidExamples.name: Caption Too Long

data.caption: This caption is extremely long and exceeds the maximum allowed length of 500 characters. It contains way too much descriptive text and detailed information that would be excessive for a typical image caption. Captions should be concise and provide essential context, not lengthy descriptions that overwhelm the reader. This example demonstrates what happens when caption text goes far beyond reasonable limits and becomes unwieldy for practical use in content management systems. We continue adding more text here to absolutely ensure that this caption exceeds the 500 character limit that is specified in the image data schema validation rules and should cause the validation to fail when tested against the schema requirements.

expectedErrors: Caption must be 500 characters or less
invalidExamples.notes: Should fail due to caption length
